==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|草|履}}

===Etymology===
Historically /zauri/. The vowel sequence /au/ regularly contracts into long {{IPAchar|[oː]|lang=ja}} via regular phonological rules becoming ''zōri''. In late Middle Japanese, the initial {{IPAchar|[zo]|lang=ja}} temporarily becomes affricate {{IPAchar|[dʒo]|lang=ja}}.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ぞうり|ゾウリ|hhira=ざうり}}

# Flat, thonged sandals.
#* c. 934: [[w:Wamyō Ruijushō|Wamyō Ruijushō]] (Volume 4)
#*:: 草履 楊氏漢語抄云草履、和名與屩同、俗云'''佐宇利'''
#* c. 1177-1188: [[w:Iroha Jiruishō|Iroha Jiruishō]]
#*: 草履 サウリ 和名与屩曰日記用浄履
#* 1444: [[w:Kagakushū|Kagakushū]] (Volume 13)
#*: 草（ジャウ）履　ザウリ

# {{n-g|Same as above.}}
